sourcing.instructions: K (Potassium) can be sourced from potassium chloride (KCl) available at chemical suppliers. Na (Sodium) can be obtained from sodium chloride (NaCl) at grocery stores or chemical suppliers. Sb (Antimony) can be found in antimony trioxide (Sb2O3) from specialty chemical suppliers. Se (Selenium) can be sourced from selenium powder from chemical suppliers.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh each ingredient carefully using a digital scale. 
 2. In a clean, dry glass container, combine 3.94 g of potassium, 1.69 g of sodium, 14.94 g of antimony, and 63.84 g of selenium. 
 3. Stir the mixture gently to ensure even distribution of the components. 
 4. Transfer the mixture to a ceramic or quartz crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.
